references.paper_title: The hanabi challenge: A new frontier for ai research
references.reason: This paper introduces a challenging collaborative game environment used as a benchmark in the current work for evaluating human-AI collaboration.

references.paper_title: On the utility of learning about humans for human-ai coordination
references.reason: This is a foundational work in human-AI collaboration that proposes a behavior cloning approach and is used as a comparison baseline in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Towards safe policy improvement for non-stationary mdps
references.reason: This paper addresses the theoretical challenges of non-stationary human behavior in MDPs, which is relevant to the current work's focus on handling non-stationary human dynamics.
This paper provides a broad overview of open problems in cooperative AI, which helps set the context for the current research on human-AI collaboration.
This paper introduces the Bayesian Policy Reuse (BPR) framework, which is extended in the current paper to handle human-AI collaboration and provides theoretical underpinnings for the CBPR method.
